meanings.definition: Scatter among or between other things
meanings.sent1: She enjoys interspersing colorful flowers in her garden.
meanings.sent2: The chef is interspersing herbs throughout the dish for added flavor.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was interspersing acorns in random places, creating a treasure hunt for itself.
meanings.sent4: The stars were interspersing the night sky like diamonds on black velvet.
meanings.sent5: The artist was interspersing bold strokes of color in the painting, creating a vibrant masterpiece.

meanings.definition: Insert at intervals in something else
meanings.sent1: He is carefully interspersing footnotes in his research paper.
meanings.sent2: The designer is interspersing buttons along the jacket for a stylish look.
meanings.sent3: The magician was interspersing unexpected tricks in his performance, keeping the audience entertained.
meanings.sent4: The author was interspersing humor throughout the book, making it a delightful read.
meanings.sent5: The musician was interspersing soft melodies in the song, creating a soothing atmosphere.
